relation: Distance to Drive (mi)/ Current Mileage from HWY 93
pageTitle: Baldy Peak, NV : Climbing, Hiking & Mountaineering : SummitPost
textBeforeTable: From Here, follow the GPS Coordinates in the table below and reset your Odometer. Drive North on HWY 93 for approx 39.1 miles From Ely, NV Getting ThereThe last 23 miles or so to get here is on dirt roads. You should be able to reach the trail head with a good 2WD. However, a high clearance vehicle is highly recommended. Baldy Peak requires about 25 miles of off roading in order to reach it. It is far from civilization. The closest community McGill which is along HWY 93 just North of Ely, NV. Be sure you have plenty of gas and supplies. Keep your eye open on the drive in, you are likely to see wild horses. Goshute Indian Reservation . Ibapah Peak in Utah can also be enjoyed. Straight East from the summit you can get a look into the Ruby Mountains on the edge of the horizon. Great views to the East of Spruce Mountain as well as the North Schell Peak and the snow capped peaks of the Schell Range. To the west one can see Becky Peak. To the north and in the distance you can see Wheeler Peak, Nevada's Prominence List. Some maps show Baldy Peak as BM Smoothie. Views are great
textAfterTable: From Salt Lake City, UT Head West on I-80 for Approx 120 miles to West Wendover, NV At exit 410, turn Left onto Ramp for 0.3 miles Turn Left (South) onto US-93 Alt for 0.2 miles Turn Left (East) onto US-93 Alt [Wendover Blvd] Turn Right (South) onto US-Alt 93 for 54.7 miles - Just before this turn you’ll cross into White Pine County. From Here, follow the GPS Coordinates in the table below and reset your Odometer.
